title: CSS Transitions & Animations Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of CSS transitions and keyframe animations

questions.question: What does the transition property do?
choices: Smoothly changes a property when it changes
questions.explanation: Smoothly changes a property when it changes — Used for hover, focus, or class-based changes.

questions.question: Which property defines keyframe animations?
questions.explanation: @keyframes — Defines the sequence of frames for an animation.

questions.question: How do you make an animation repeat indefinitely?
questions.explanation: animation-iteration-count: infinite — Loops the animation endlessly.

questions.question: Which shorthand combines name, duration, and timing for an animation?
questions.explanation: animation: moveBox 2s ease; — Combines animation-name, animation-duration, and animation-timing-function.

questions.question: Why use transitions instead of keyframes for hover effects?
choices: Transitions are simpler for changes triggered by user actions like hover or focus
questions.explanation: Transitions are simpler for changes triggered by user actions like hover or focus — Keyframes are better for continuous or complex animations.
